title: World Cup 2022: Qatar beaten by Ecuador as dream turns into nightmare
description: Qatar were beaten by Ecuador as the dreams of the host nation turned into a nightmare at Al Bayt Stadium.

title: Turkey Kurdish strikes: A population living in fear
description: After the recent bombing in Istanbul, Turkish retaliatory air strikes on Kurdish targets have left a population on edge.

title: ATP Finals: Novak Djokovic beats Casper Ruud to equal Roger Federer's record
description: Former world number one Novak Djokovic beats Casper Ruud to win a record-equalling sixth ATP Finals.

title: England: 'No escape from furnace and expectation at World Cup 2022'
description: With England set to open their World Cup campaign against Iran on Monday, BBC Sport's Phil McNulty takes a closer look at what is at stake.

title: World Cup 2022: England and Wales braced for tournament openers
description: Gareth Southgate says he wants to take England fans on a happy journey while Wales captain Gareth Bale relishes a "massive piece" of Wales' football history.

title: Martyn's Law: PM urged not to delay venue security bill
description: Protect Duty, or Martyn's Law, was introduced in the wake of the Manchester Arena bombing.

title: World Cup 2022: Qatar 0-2 Ecuador: Enner Valencia double gives South Americans win
description: Hosts Qatar open the 2022 Fifa World Cup in calamitous fashion, easily beaten by Ecuador in a humbling defeat at Al Bayt.

title: World Cup 2022: Enner Valencia scores double as hosts lose opening game
description: Watch highlights as Qatar become the first host nation to lose their opening game as Ecuador captain Enner Valencia scores twice.

title: England: Gareth Southgate says players will take the knee before Iran World Cup 2022 match
description: Gareth Southgate says his England players will take the knee before Monday's World Cup opener against Iran.

title: Joe Lycett 'shreds' £10k in David Beckham Qatar protest
description: The comedian appears to destroy wads of banknotes in an industrial shredder in a clip posted on Twitter.

title: Dominic Raab warns terrorists over further prison time
description: Dominic Raab says terrorist offenders will be punished if they are "unwilling to change their ways".

title: World Cup 2022: Morgan Freeman and Jung Kook star in glitzy opening ceremony
description: The 2022 World Cup kicks off with a visually striking opening ceremony before the first match between hosts Qatar and Ecuador.

title: Iran captain voices solidarity with protests at home
description: Iran captain Ehsan Hajsafi speaks out against the situation in his home country before his nation's opening game against England at the World Cup.

title: World Cup 2022: Enner Valencia's second doubles Ecuador's lead against Qatar
description: Watch as Ecuador captain Enner Valencia scores his second goal as Ecuador lead Qatar 2-0 in the opening game of the Fifa World Cup in Qatar.

title: Nottingham: Murder probe as children, three and one, die in flat fire
description: Firefighters say they were called out after neighbours in Nottingham saw smoke coming from the flat.

title: England v New Zealand: Matt Dawson says 'Marcus Smith kick dead stopped me in my tracks'
description: England fans saw reasons to be cheerful and fearful in the dramatic draw with New Zealand, writes World Cup winner Matt Dawson.

title: Pundits on Qatar controversies and 'bizarre' Infantino rant
description: Watch as BBC Sport pundits Alan Shearer, Alex Scott and Ashely Williams have an important conversation surrounding the World Cup in Qatar.

title: Australia triumph & 'extraordinary steps' taken - but where next for rugby league?
description: Australia's victory over Samoa brought the curtain down on the World Cup - but what's the future for international rugby league?

title: World Cup 2022: Gareth Bale ready for 'historic' Wales opener v USA
description: Gareth Bale is ready to lead Wales in a "massive piece of history" when he captains them in their first World Cup match for 64 years on Monday.

title: Zaporizhzhia shelling: Explosions at occupied nuclear site in Ukraine
description: The head of the nuclear watchdog issues an urgent plea after new blasts near the Zaporizhzhia plant.

title: What is loss and damage and will rich nations pay for climate change?
description: In a landmark deal, richer nations agree to give money to developing nations facing climate change.

title: Chelsea 3-0 Tottenham: Manager Emma Hayes returns as Blues go top of WSL
description: Chelsea mark the return of manager Emma Hayes and a record home crowd by beating Tottenham 3-0 at Stamford Bridge.

title: Abu Dhabi Grand Prix: Max Verstappen wins as Sebastian Vettel scores points in final race
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen wins the final race of the season in Abu Dhabi as Ferrari's Charles Leclerc beats Sergio Perez to secure second in the championship.

title: World Cup 2022: Joe Allen ruled out of Wales opener against United States
description: Wales midfielder Joe Allen is out of Monday's World Cup opener against the United States with a hamstring injury.

title: World Cup 2022: How Wales can start 'dream' World Cup with a win
description: Former Wales defender and BBC pundit Danny Gabbidon on how Rob Page's side can start their first World Cup for 64 years by beating the United States.

title: Gwent Police: New messages reveal more misconduct allegations
description: The messages include Jimmy Savile jokes, a video of a woman stripping, and leaked nude images.

title: Jeremy Hunt has no plan for growth, says CBI boss
description: Tony Danker tells the BBC the Autumn Statement will tackle inflation but won't revive growth.

title: Church plans vigil for woman missing in River Don
description: Police confirm the search has entered its third day at Monymusk as the local community gathers in hope.

title: Ukraine war: We will rebuild, vows mayor of flattened Mariupol
description: The key city is occupied by Russia - but the exiled Ukrainian mayor is still making plans.

title: Health Secretary Steve Barclay defends delay to social care cap
description: Steve Barclay says the delay is a "difficult decision" but will allow more funding for social care.

title: COP27: Climate costs deal struck but no fossil fuel progress
description: Rich nations will pay climate damages, but the final deal does not cut fossil fuels further.

title: Club Q Colorado shooting: Five dead after attack at nightclub

title: Met Police passes file on cash-for-honours allegations to prosecutors

title: World Cup 2022: Can you name all the players in the BBC opening titles?

description: Operation Claw-Sword targeted sites in Syria and Iraq a week after a deadly bombing in Istanbul.

title: World Cup 2022: How Qatar built a team 'ready to dazzle the world'

title: World Cup 2022: Inside Qatar's £175-a-night fan village
description: BBC Sport's Nesta McGregor visits Qatar's £175-a-night tented fan village to find out what supporters think of the experience.

title: World Cup 2022: Spending the night at Qatar's £175-a-night fan village
description: BBC Sport's Nesta McGregor spends the night at the Qetaifan Island Fan Village just north of Doha, where football fans are arriving for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.

title: Awaab Ishak: Councils put 'on notice' following toddler's mould death
description: The housing secretary tells providers to improve conditions after Awaab Ishak's death due to mould in his home.

title: Talking therapy: How ice cream is helping people discuss difficult topics
description: Artist Annie Nicholson's work has centred around grief since she lost family members in a tragic accident.

title: Safe haven laws and the surrendered infants in US
description: Michelle told no-one she was pregnant. So when she gave birth by the roadside, she did something she came to regret.

title: Jang Jung Hyuck: ‘Compared to escaping North Korea, the fights feel like nothing’
description: Jang Jung Hyuck used kickboxing to cope with the trauma of escaping North Korea.
